intro: Silphium tomentosum, commonly known as wooly silphium, is a perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Silphium tomentosum is adapted to wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas. Due to its rarity and ecological importance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
